answers.answer: Hi!Stye or hordeolum as it is medically called could be recurrent due to diabetes, recurrent touching of eye, poor hygiene, immunoglobulin M (IgM) deficiency, dry eyes, and chronic infection of eyelids. Cold compress, topical antibiotics and good person hygiene usually does the trick.However, there could also be an abscess formed in tear gland, and it is very important to show your daughter to an eye specialist. Hope this helps. Take care!
